New Records: Wales set up a 4-1 victory over Finland in their Euro 2024 play-off semi-final with an early goal by David Brooks and late goals by Neco Williams, Brennan Johnson, and Dan James.
Key Match Events: David Brooks scored a third-minute goal to settle nerves for Wales.
Neco Williams and Brennan Johnson scored in the first half.
Dan James added a late fourth goal to secure the victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Wales boss Rob Page emphasized the need for a strong performance against Poland, with keeping Robert Lewandowski quiet as their primary goal.
Poland had a dominant 5-1 victory over 10-man Estonia in their semi-final.
Post-Match Reflections: Wales' performance against Poland will be crucial as they aim to secure qualification to Euro 2024.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match can be watched on Viaplay Sports 1 and S4C.
Viaplay is available as a subscription service or through Virgin Media and Sky TV.
BBC Radio 5 Live will provide live radio coverage.
Others: The match is the final step for Wales in their Euro 2024 qualification journey.
Promotional content includes subscription offers and a newsletter signup for football updates.
